did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: James Brand (J.B) Tenney, 1884-1959, was an assistant geologist for the Arizona Bureau of Mines. This collection is a Typescript of Arizona mining history, chiefly covers the period from 1849 to 1930. Edited and prepared from Mr. Tenney's original manuscript by the Special Collections Division, University of Arizona Library, 1959-1960.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.p: History of Mining in Arizona (AZ 198). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Assistant Geologist, Arizona Bureau of Mines.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized by mining district and county.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Typescript of Arizona mining history, chiefly covers the period from 1849 to 1930. Edited and prepared from Mr. Tenney's original manuscript by the Special Collections Division, University of Arizona Library, 1959-1960.

Vol. 1 provides a general history of mining in Arizona from 1521-1929; a detailed history of Bisbee, Jerome, Globe- Miami, Clifton-Morenci, Ray-Christmas, Ajo, Superior, and Tombstone; and a general history of the smaller camps grouped by county; and background information concerning mines and mining companies.

Vol. 2 contains charts of production statistics, showing copper, lead, silver, and gold prices and amounts produced for each district, 1875- 1929; for some mines, including Silver King Mine and Ray Mine; and for some companies, including Detroit Copper Company, Arizona Copper Company, and United Verde Copper Company.
